definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
the Great Learning, one of the Four Books 四書|四书[Si4 shu1] in Confucianism
the Great Learning, one of the Four Books 四書|四书[Si4 shu1] in Confucianism
to expand/to enlarge/to broaden one's scope
(of an area) vast or extensive/large-scale/widespread/(of people) numerous
in large part/the greater part/the majority

sentences.english: She’s always grousing about the work-load.
What you need is a good-sized canvas bag.
sentences.chinese: 你需要的是一个比较大的帆布袋。

sentences.english: And the big money is with the brand advertisers.
sentences.chinese: 而且大品牌广告商拥有更多的广告费用。

sentences.english: A red carpet stretched across the cement floor, welcomingvisitors to a huge door that appeared to be forged of solid metal.
sentences.chinese: 水泥地上的红地毯一直延伸到一扇厚厚的金属大门前。

sentences.english: It has a set of changeable spindles with wide measuring range.
sentences.chinese: 备有一组可换接杆，测量范围大。

sentences.english: We need to experience major events like the Olympics.
sentences.chinese: 我们需要经历奥运这样的大事件。

sentences.english: Therefore, how can I not love the warm wash carvedilol primary large group?
sentences.chinese: 因此，我怎能不爱洗洛小学这个温暖的大集体？

sentences.english: I will praise God's name in song and glorify him with thanksgiving.
sentences.chinese: 我要以诗歌赞美神的名，以感谢称他为大。

sentences.english: In the intimate circle of Friendlies, Huanhuan is the big brother.
sentences.chinese: 在体内循环的友谊赛，欢欢是大哥哥。

sentences.english: The southern portion of the country is taken up by the Gobi Desert, while the northern and western portions are mountainous.
sentences.chinese: 该国南部是戈壁大沙漠，北部和西部都是高山。

sentences.english: AMERICA'S political priorities have undergone a breathtaking about-turn.
sentences.chinese: 美国政治上优先考虑的事情已然经历了一个大转变。

sentences.english: China may soon make a big contribution to the bank's intellectual ranks.
sentences.chinese: 中国可能很快就会为世行的学者队伍作一个大贡献。

sentences.english: The former chief has got typhus fever on board.
sentences.chinese: 前任大副在船得过斑疹伤寒症。

sentences.english: How big is the significance of Nan Qi's 3-D work?
sentences.chinese: 南溪这样做的意义有多大？

sentences.english: Probably the most noticeable thing we would see is the big, important seat of the judge.
sentences.chinese: 最显眼的可能就是法官所坐的大靠背椅。

sentences.english: And it’s goingto be up to you to make an even bigger difference over the next 40years.
sentences.chinese: 未来40年更大的改变也将取决于你们。

definition: many/much/often/a lot of/numerous/more/in excess/how (to what extent)/multi-/Taiwan pr. [duo2] when it means "how"
of/~'s (possessive particle)/(used after an attribute)/(used to form a nominal expression)/(used at the end of a declarative sentence for emphasis)
few/less/to lack/to be missing/to stop (doing sth)/seldom
to be fond of/to have a tendency to/to be prone to
good/well/proper/good to/easy to/very/so/(suffix indicating completion or readiness)/(of two people) close/on intimate terms/(after a personal pronoun) hello
how old?/how big?/how much?/so big/that much
to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be
(completed action marker)/(modal particle indicating change of state, situation now)/(modal particle intensifying preceding clause)
to finish/to achieve/variant of 瞭|了[liao3]/to understand clearly
